title: SM UC-102
text:
SM "UC-102" was a German <a href="German%20Type%20UC%20III%20submarine">Type UC III</a> <a href="minelayer">minelaying</a> <a href="submarine">submarine</a> or <a href="U-boat">U-boat</a> in the <a href="German%20Imperial%20Navy">German Imperial Navy</a> () during <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a>.
Design.
A <a href="German%20Type%20UC%20III%20submarine">German Type UC III submarine</a>, "UC-102" had a displacement of when at the surface and while submerged. She had a <a href="length%20overall">length overall</a> of , a <a href="beam%20%28ship%29">beam</a> of , and a <a href="draught%20%28ship%29">draught</a> of . The submarine was powered by two six-cylinder four-stroke diesel engines each producing (a total of ), two electric motors producing , and two <a href="propeller%20shaft">propeller shaft</a>s. She had a dive time of 15 seconds and was capable of operating at a depth of .
The submarine was designed for a maximum surface speed of and a submerged speed of . When submerged, she could operate for at ; when surfaced, she could travel at . "UC-102" was fitted with six mine tubes, fourteen UC 200 mines, three <a href="torpedo%20tube">torpedo tube</a>s (one on the stern and two on the bow), seven <a href="torpedo">torpedo</a>es, and one <a href="10.5%20cm%20SK%20L/45%20naval%20gun">SK L/45</a> or <a href="8.8%20cm%20SK%20L/30%20naval%20gun">Uk L/30</a> <a href="deck%20gun">deck gun</a> . Her <a href="Ship%27s%20company">complement</a> was twenty-six crew members.
Construction and career.
The U-boat was ordered on 12 January 1916 and was <a href="launch%20%28ship%29">launch</a>ed on 14 April 1918. She was <a href="commission%20%28ship%29">commission</a>ed into the German Imperial Navy on 14 October 1918 as SM "UC-102". As with the rest of the completed UC III boats, "UC-102" conducted no war patrols and sank no ships. She was surrendered on 22 November 1918 and <a href="ship%20breaking">broken up</a> in <a href="Dordrecht">Dordrecht</a> in 1922.
